title: Drawing, "Study of a Saint During a Plague", ca. 1790
medium: Brush and black wash, pen and black ink, black chalk on paper
markings: watermark: lily in double ovoid over "A"
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower left corner: "M.Rossi"
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A saint is shown praying in the moat of a town in the right foreground.  Dead and dying persons lie in the moat and are thrown into it.  Framing stripe and line.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study of a Saint During a Plague", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Brush and black wash, pen and black ink, black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7329.
